text: Cool and weird stuff inside Valve's offices: <http://kotaku.com/emergency-eye-wash-and-other-strange-things-at-valves-o-1603000281>

attachments.title: Emergency Eye Wash And Other Strange Things At Valve's Offices
attachments.text: For many people, touring a video game studio is like taking a trip to nerd heaven. Valve let the winners of its 2013 Saxxy Awards film contest peek behind the curtain in this way. The resulting photo gallery that was recently posted online makes the place look about as whacky as you'd expect the company that's made games like Half Life, Team Fortress, and Portal to be.
attachments.fallback: Kotaku: Emergency Eye Wash And Other Strange Things At Valve's Offices

text: i think valve was the first company i ever applied to. or maybe it was computer city. i may have called their front desk, looking for summer work in high school?

It's still pretty mysterious what their hiring team looks for in candidates. They're pretty secretive. I know exactly zero people who have or do work there.
i know a designer and an engineer there.

sup guys (and gals)
We're currently on the fence between a PS4 and an XBox One, because... we feel like we should get one. And I really don't have an informed opinion beyond that one South Park episode.
any advice?
Question 1: Do you have any favorite games that are system locked?
(ie, Halo, Killzone, God of War, etc)
not really.
I was really into MLB the show a few summers ago
think that's ps4
Cool. Question 2: Do you have a favorite controller? PS3 dualshock? 360 controller?
my last system was a ps3, but i dont mind the xbox controller
one of my fav illustrators did a bunch of work for xbox one
<http://blog.invisiblecreature.com/ic-for-xbox-one/>
Cool, cool. Question 3: Do you really like the idea of voice commands or gesture control?
OMG wow - I know those exact gamer pics
That's super awesome
i think motion / kinect / wii type stuff is going to get most of the paly
i'm thinking the main use will be friends (non gamers) over for a bbq, and me staying up late building dynasties in sports games like Madden, NCAA, etc
I guess the last profiling question would be wether you have a lot of other Microsoft devices, since there's some cool connections there between Xbox and WIndows 8 stuff
none
everything is apple
I had a feeling :grinning:
comast...
that xbox picture in picture seems cool
It's pretty neat
Man, you're a tough case. I personally have an Xbox One (well, it's in OH), and got it for the console exclusive titles, as well as my long history with Xbox.
That said, I feel like you should do some digging to make sure there aren;t any 'deal breaker' games you are going to want that are system locked before choosing for sure.
From there though, it's a lot about utilization and services
Both platforms can support netflix and many other TV services
the One has Skype built in, which is cool
And can also work alongside your TV to do some cool stuff, like the PIP stuff. I haven;t messed with it (no cable) but it seems legit
cool. that actually helps
It seems like you are traditionally from the PS side of things, so the familiarity of the platform might be a positive for you
or not. i like cool / new UI
the One's UI us based on the Metro interface that's part of 8, and it's pretty slick, IMHO
tiles and shit
the inclusion of the Kinect 2 is a nice bonus as well, as you won't need to buy something else later
That said, it does raise the price of the one to be slightly more than the PS4, though there are sales a lot now
does xbox still charge for live?
The PS4 does have a motion control system as well, known as the PS Camera, and it works with the PS Move controller to do similar things. There is limited game support for it at this time, though.
Yes, Live is still required for online play and many services, though there are some that will be free soon (I think Netflix is one...not sure about the others)
It's pretty cheap still, $60/year retail, but I always get a year for  like $35 on sale, so it's not bad
oh word
dude. i'm thinking xbox
i'll let you know for sure
As an owner of one, I have been quite pleased
For sure. Let me know if you have specific questions as well...happy to help if I can.
I've spent far too much time looking over them both, so it's nice to be able to use that knowledge
